title: 109_hr5110
content: The "More Water and More Energy Act of 2006" is cited as the short title. The Water Resources Research Act of 1984 is amended to include a new section on produced water. The Secretary will conduct a study to identify obstacles to using produced water for irrigation and other purposes, and report the results to specific committees within a year. The Secretary is authorized to fund projects in Upper Basin States, Lower Basin States (excluding California), and California with a maximum of $1,000,000 per project. The funds can cover up to 50% of the project cost and cannot be used for facility operation or maintenance. The Secretary consults with relevant officials and reviews research information in implementing the section, including preparing reports and establishing criteria for awarding assistance. The Secretary consults with experts and industry professionals, seeks public input, and ensures compliance with state and federal laws. The curr_chunk defines key terms related to the regulation of produced water, including the definition of produced water, the role of the Secretary of the Interior, and the classification of Upper Basin and Lower Basin States. It also defines a project as the development of a facility to demonstrate processes for increasing the recovery and usability of produced water. The curr_chunk discusses the authorization of appropriations for a study on the recovery and usability of produced water for various purposes. The House of Representatives passed the authorization of appropriations for a study on the recovery and usability of produced water on December 5, 2006.
